title: Wins and losses are no longer adequate for determining MMR
body:
Some sort of rating system has been needed for years now. It would be really cool if someone at Riot put literally **any** effort into improving the clusterfuck we have right now, where the majority of games feel like dice rolls.

It's frustrating to consistently perform well and still barely hold 50% win rate, because there's little to no reward for playing well; the worst player influences the outcome magnitudes more than the best player(s), because no matter how good you are, you can't win the numbers game when the enemy team is thousands of gold ahead.

I said the team with the worst player loses. The four other players can be better than all five of the winning team's, but it doesn't matter, because the worst player holds most of the impact.

yeah no, you can keep saying that all you want. If the 4 players would be better than the 5 players that means you have at least 4 people who are more fed than their one... oh wait! you don't have that. All you have is one fed enemy vs your ZERO fed allies and then complain that the "worst player is what matters" this type of mentality is what is causing the snowball we have now.

So is your solution to rank people based on something other than winning?  That would likely incentivize play that is not in line with winning the game.  For instance if it was based on kda, you'd never join a fight where you'd die even if your presence there won your team the fight (at the cost of your death).

The only proper way to rank people is by how much they win.

No. If League is going to use the Chess elo system, it better rewards individual score. If you play a chess tournament in teams, your win/loss is determined by your team score, but your ELO is determined by your win/loss against your opponent. You can have your team WIN and still lose elo in chess because you lost against your opponent.

KDA should not be a factor is deciding score, but KDA, cs, ward count, objective taken, score relative to opponent laner, score relative to team should all be considered in assigning your mmr. I've carried dumbfucks who had a total of 2 wards placed in the entire game, and trust me, they do not deserve that mmr gain.
